description: From out- +‎ yard (“enclosed area designated for a specific purpose”).

entries.meaning: (beekeeping) A temporary location with better sources of pollen to which a hive is moved during times when the plants in the normal location of the hive have dried up.

description: From out- +‎ yard (“unit of length equal to 3 feet”).

verbs.description: outyard (third-person singular simple present outyards, present participle outyarding, simple past and past participle outyarded)

entries.meaning: (American football) To gain more yards than.
